title: Acadia National Park: Basic Information
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information             Basic Information                   Current Conditions               Winter Activities               Fees and Passes                 Physical Address           20 McFarland Hill Drive  Bar Harbor, ME 04609                 Directions         From Boston take I-95 north to Augusta, Maine, then Route 3 east to Ellsworth, and on to Mount Desert Island. For an alternate route, continue on I-95 north to Bangor, Maine, then take Route 1A east to Ellsworth. In Ellsworth, take Route 3 to Mount Desert Island.  Directions Details           Operating Hours & Seasons       For more information about visitor centers and campgrounds, please visit our Operating Hours & Seasons page.   Operating Hours The park is open 24 hours a day, every day of the year. A number of park roads close during the winter including Park Loop Road, Cadillac Mountain Road, and all of the unpaved roads. Most facilities close in the winter as well, but Park Headquarters is open for information and park passes.   Standard Hours    Sunday: Open 24 hours   Monday: Open 24 hours   Tuesday: Open 24 hours   Wednesday: Open 24 hours   Thursday: Open 24 hours   Friday: Open 24 hours   Saturday: Open 24 hours             Weather           Located on Mount Desert Island in Maine, Acadia experiences all four seasons. Summer temperatures range from 45-90F (7-30C). Fall temperatures range from 30-70F (-1-21C). Typically the first frost is in mid-October and first snowfall begins in November and can continue through April with an average accumulation of 73 inches (185 cm). Winter temperatures range from 14-35F (-10 - 2C). Spring temperatures range from 30-70F (-1-21C).   Weather         Fees & Passes    For more information about entrance fees and where to buy your park pass, visit our Fees & Passes page.  Entrance Fees:   Acadia Entrance Fee - Private Vehicle - $25.00 Admits private, non-commercial vehicle (15 passenger capacity or less) and all occupants. Valid for 7 days. If a vehicle pass is purchased, no other pass is necessary.   Acadia Entrance Fee - Motorcycle - $20.00 Admits one or two passengers on a private, non-commercial motorcycle. Valid for 7 days.   Acadia Entrance Fee - Per Person - $12.00 Admits one individual with no car (bicyclist, hiker, pedestrian). Youth 15 and under are admitted free of charge. Valid for 7 days.   Entrance Passes:   Acadia Annual Pass - $50.00 Valid for 12 months from purchase date. This pass provides access to Acadia National Park only. This pass admits the pass holder and passengers in a non-commercial vehicle.         Visitor Centers     For more information about visitor centers, visit our Operating Hours & Seasons page.   Park Headquarters Information, park passes, Eastern National bookstore, lost and found, Ranger Office, permits. Park passes are sold until 4 pm.   Hulls Cove Visitor Center Information, park movie, park passes, exhibits, and Eastern National bookstore.   Thompson Island Information Center Park and chambers of commerce information and park passes.   Village Green Information Center Information,  Island Explorer buses, and park passes.   Islesford Historical Museum Museum, exhibits, and Eastern National bookstore.   Sieur de Monts Nature Center Exhibits, information, hiking information, and Wild Gardens.   Rockefeller Welcome Center Exhibits about old Navy base and information.               Current Conditions What is it like right now?  Permits & Reservations Weddings, commercial filming, groups, and more.  Pets Bring your furry family member along!  Goods & Services Stores, post offices, and more.
